Might win an Oscar, you can never tell

The Oscar is an award given out by the American Academy of Arts and Sciences for the best work in film each year. On rare occasions, non-actors have won the award by “acting naturally”. At the time of this song’s writing it had happened only once, in 1947, when Harold Russell won Best Supporting Actor for his role in “The Best Years Of Our Lives”

Ringo was the lead actor in the Beatles' 1965 film comedy, “Help!” The plot revolved around an evil cult attempting retrieve a sacred ring that somehow ended up on Ringo’s finger.





Ironically, this song was one of the few song on the Help album that not featured in the movie.

Acting naturally is notoriously difficult, otherwise everybody would be doing it.

The actor and director Constantin Stanislavski created a method to help actors act in a naturalistic manner by getting inside the mind of their character. Method actors, who use Stanislavski’s method, include Daniel Day-Lewis, Meryl Streep, and, tragically, Heath Ledger.
